greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Simple self-inverse permutation of natural numbers: List each clump of phi(n) numbers (starting from phi(2) = 1) in reverse order.
link: Index entries for sequences that are permutations of the natural numbers
maple: ReverseNextPhi_n_elements_permutation(30); with(numtheory,phi); ReverseNextPhi_n_elements_permutation := proc(u) local m,a,n,k,i; a := []; k := 0; for n from 2 to u do m := k + phi(n); for i from 1 to phi(n) do a := [op(a),m]; m := m-1; k := k+1; od; od; RETURN(a); end;
mathematica: A[u_]:=Block[{m, a={}, n, k=0, i}, For[n=2, n<=u, n++, m=k + EulerPhi[n]; For[i=1, i<=EulerPhi[n], i++, AppendTo[a, m]; m=m - 1; k = k + 1]]; Return [a]]; A[30] (* _Indranil Ghosh_, May 23 2017, translated from MAPLE code *)
program: print(A(30)) # _Indranil Ghosh_, May 23 2017, translated from MAPLE code
xref: Maps fractions between A020652/A020653 and A020653/A020652.
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_
